column1: How is the situation in Coorg. Is it stable now? Or it is still in recovering phase? Any signs of epidemic? Had plans to travel to Coorg for couple of days in September end - not sure if I should change it.
Ban on travel to Coorg lifted from today.However tourists advised not to visit Abby Falls, Mullpatti and a few other places.Rest is fine

We've planned our Coorg trip from September 13 - September 16. We have booked resort in Madikeri and we'll be driving from Mysore. Are roads safe to drive from Mysore to Coorg? Also as asked in original question - Any signs of epidemic?
Things are getting back to normal. Mysuru-Coorg roads are safe except for a few stretches of repair works .There is no epidemic threat in Coorg.
@rohit how was your coorg trip because we are planning to visit on october first week. So can u please share the updates in coorg
@rohit can you tell your experience.. how was your trip so that it will be useful for us.. thanks in advanceEdited: 1 year ago

I've been there from monday to thursday..started my journey from mysore..we booked the home stay in madikeri nr. Raja's seat...the roads are safe..some of the places are closed like abbey falls, mallali falls(not sure), mandalpatti, tadiyandabol, tala kaveri temple is opened but the view point which is located upstairs is closed due to landslides..you can stay there 2-3 days there for sight seeing and then 2 days in mysore for other falls and local sight seeing.. however the gate keeper of the abbey falls said it will be opened from 1st of october..Edited: 1 year ago
@ Deepak , We are planning for a coorg visit by mid october , is it okay now for travel with family?
